channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CBS News 24/7 Credits 2024
item.description: Recognizing the CBS journalists & production staff who worked tirelessly to provide 24/7 news coverage in 2024.

item.title: What was 'Disease X' and what can we learn from it?
item.description: Four weeks after a puzzling outbreak was reported in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the World Health Organization has identified the cause.

item.title: Foreign fighters given senior Syrian army posts, reports say
item.description: The move will raise concerns over the role radicalised foreign militants may play in Syria's future.

item.title: Why has the Pitt and Jolie divorce taken eight years?
item.description: The pair were married for two years - but it has taken four times that time to reach a divorce deal.

item.title: Chinese hackers access U.S. Treasury Department workstations, officials say
item.description: Officials say cybercriminals backed by the Chinese state government hacked the U.S. Treasury Department system, accessing federal workstations and som...

item.title: Most of Puerto Rico hit by New Year's Eve power outage
item.description: Virtually all of Puerto Rico woke up on New Year's Eve to find there was no electricity, as a power outage hit the U.S. territory.

item.title: What is a state funeral and who will attend Jimmy Carter's?
item.description: There will be multiple days of ceremonies and services in Washington DC and Georgia to honour the former president.

item.title: New technology gives hope to save endangered right whales
item.description: Conservationists are getting better at monitoring the movement of the highly endangered right whale. They hope it will encourage ships to slow down in...

item.title: Watch: Hong Kong, Taiwan and China's turn celebrate the new year
item.description: Celebrations are being held as countries welcome in the new year.

item.title: 12/31: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: Security preparations are underway ahead of New Year's Eve celebrations across the country, how to set realistic health goals for 2025 and the communi...

item.title: Puerto Rico may enter new year in darkness after sudden blackout
item.description: The US island territory has experienced severe power issues since Hurricane Maria struck in 2017

item.title: 9 unexpected things we learned about mental health and our brains in 2024
item.description: NPR's health reporters followed the emerging science on what keeps our brains and our minds healthy. Here are highlights of the studies that piqued ou...

item.title: Examining Biden's presidential legacy. And, north Gaza's last key hospital shut down
item.description: President Biden signed significant legislation that his backers say will leave a lasting impact. And, north Gaza's last major hospital has been shut d...

item.title: Power outage hits nearly all of Puerto Rico on New Year's Eve
item.description: More than 1.3 million people were plunged into darkness early Tuesday. Failure of an underground power line is believed to be the cause and repairs co...

item.title: Woman set on fire on NYC subway identified, police say
item.description: The woman who was set on fire on the NYC subway has been identified as Debrina Kawam, of Toms River, New Jersey, police say.
